details: CEO Andy Jassy mandated 350,000+ corporate employees return to office 5 days per week starting January 2, 2025, ending the previous 3-day hybrid policy.
CEO Jamie Dimon ordered all employees back 5 days a week, ending hybrid arrangements. Internal memo warned that non-compliance would have consequences.
Required all office-based employees to work from the office 5 days per week starting January 2025, consolidating offices to Dallas HQ and other hubs.
Was among the first major firms to require full 5-day return. CEO David Solomon called remote work an 'aberration' and strictly enforced attendance.
After Skydance acquired Paramount, mandated 5 days at LA and NY offices from January 2026. Offered severance to those who wouldn't return.
All office-based employees required full-time in office from January 2026, replacing previous hybrid and remote options globally.
Corporate employees required back 5 days per week from April 6, 2026, accompanied by cuts to some remote-eligible roles.
Required all employees back to the office 5 days per week, ending hybrid arrangements for corporate staff.
US semiconductor division required 5-day attendance with tracking tools to monitor 'coffee badging' and ensure compliance.
Parent company ByteDance required US-based TikTok employees to return to the office 5 days per week.
Ended 'Global Flexible Working' policy. Required 5-day in-office attendance with only 12 remote days per year (max 2 per month).
Sales teams required 5 days. Remote employees reclassified and effectively excluded from promotions and internal transfers.
Executive order from President Trump required full return to office for most federal employees, ending pandemic-era telework policies.
Corporate employees required full-time at Bentonville, AR headquarters. Remote workers told to relocate or leave as part of broader consolidation.
CEO Will Lewis mandated 5-day return to the office, eliminating all hybrid and remote work arrangements.
Moved from hybrid to full 5-day requirement for all previously hybrid staff starting January 2026.
Officially requires 3 specific days (Tue/Thu + 1 team day), but many teams pushed to 4 days. Badge tracking used to enforce compliance.
CEO Brian Niccol required corporate staff at Seattle and Toronto hubs to work 4 defined 'common days' per week. Managers must relocate near offices.
Required managing directors to work at least 4 days in the office, with signals of expanding stricter rules to more staff levels.
Required 4 days in office Monday through Thursday, with Fridays remaining remote. Offered voluntary severance to those who preferred not to comply.
CEO Mark Read mandated 4-day in-office requirement for 114,000 staff worldwide. Triggered employee petition with 18,000+ signatures opposing the move.
Required at least 4 days per week for corporate employees. Employees protested, including hacking office screens with anti-RTO messages.
Required corporate employees to work in the office 4-5 days per week, up from the previous hybrid arrangement.
Requires 3 days per week in office. Office attendance factored into performance reviews, and some remote workers asked to return or accept buyouts.
Requires at least 3 days per week for employees within 50 miles of an office. CEO Satya Nadella emphasized flexibility as a competitive advantage.
Required 3 days per week for office-assigned employees starting September 2023. Tracks badge data to monitor compliance.
Maintains 3-day hybrid model with swipe card attendance tracking in UK and US offices. Non-compliance factors into performance reviews.
CEO Bob Iger initially mandated 4 days per week for corporate employees. One of the earliest entertainment companies to push aggressive RTO.
CEO Arvind Krishna required executives and managers to be in office at least 3 days per week, warning that remote managers risk their positions.
Required hybrid and remote employees to work at least 3 days per week in the office starting March 2025.
Generally expects 3+ days in office. Co-CEO Greg Peters has emphasized a strong in-person culture without a rigid formal mandate.
Required hybrid employees to come in at least 3 days per week, with some roles requiring more.
Offers office-flex (1-3 days), office-based (4-5 days), or fully remote depending on role. CEO Benioff has emphasized voluntary in-office culture.
Employees choose @office (3+ days), @flex (up to 2 days), or @home options. Choices made annually. Widely cited as a model for flexible work.
Requires 2 days per week for employees within 50 miles of an office. CEO Eric Yuan described the policy as an ongoing experiment.
Maintains remote-first culture with optional offices and quarterly in-person gatherings. Part of Salesforce since 2021.
'Work From Anywhere' program allows employees to choose home, office, or co-working space. HR chief said treating employees like adults improved retention.
CEO Brian Chesky announced employees can live and work anywhere, including 170+ countries for up to 90 days per location.
'Virtual First' model. Physical offices converted to collaborative 'Dropbox Studios' for optional team meetups only.
Remote-first with no HQ. Offices available but optional. No location-based pay adjustments within the US.
Employees choose remote, hybrid, or in-office. Same pay regardless of location within the same country.
Majority of roles are remote-eligible. Strong remote culture with no plans to mandate office return for most employees.
Required all employees to return full-time to the office. Sent 'letters of education' to employees not meeting attendance thresholds.
Most employees required in office at least 3 days per week under a structured hybrid model with attendance monitoring.
CEO James Gorman was an early proponent of full return, telling staff 'if you can go to a restaurant, you can come to the office.'
CEO Larry Fink required employees in the office at least 4 days per week, emphasizing in-person collaboration for culture building.
Hybrid approach with most employees expected in office 2-3 days per week. Flexible by team and location.
Flexible hybrid model allowing employees to choose when to come in. CEO Michael Miebach emphasized trust-based flexibility.
Hybrid employees required in office 3 days per week (Tue-Thu). Called 'Amex Flex' model with some roles fully in-person.
Required hybrid employees to work in office at least 3 days per week. Some roles designated as fully in-person.
New CEO C.S. Venkatakrishnan pushed stricter enforcement of 3-day minimum, with some senior roles expecting more.
Required employees to spend at least 3 days per week in the office, with managing directors expected in more frequently.
Required most employees to work from the office at least 3 days per week following the Credit Suisse integration. Stricter rules for senior staff.
Increased in-office requirement to 4 days per week for most employees, up from the previous 3-day hybrid model.
Required most employees to be in office 4 days per week, up from a previous 3-day requirement.
Requires employees to be in the office at least 3 days per week (Tue/Wed/Thu). CEO Dara Khosrowshahi emphasized in-person collaboration.
Fully flexible model allowing employees to work from anywhere. Offices available but optional. Shifted to remote-first in 2023.
After Elon Musk's acquisition, ended remote work and required full-time in-office attendance. 'Extremely hardcore' work culture enforced.
Flexible work policy with most employees choosing between remote, hybrid, and in-office. Moved HQ from California to Austin, TX.
Required employees to work in the office 3 days per week, tightening the previous flexible policy under new leadership.
Hybrid model requiring most employees to be in office approximately 3 days per week, with flexibility by team and role.
CEO Evan Spiegel mandated 4 days per week in office, citing the need for in-person collaboration at a creative company.
Flexible 'PinFlex' policy allows employees to choose whether to work from home or office. One of the more flexible tech companies.
Hybrid-flexible approach. Employees can choose remote or office-based work, with in-person collaboration encouraged but not mandated daily.
CEO Alex Karp has strongly advocated for in-office work. Employees are generally expected in the office full-time.
Flexible hybrid policy where employees choose their work location. Offices available for collaboration but no strict mandate.
Flexible 'People Pact' allows employees to choose how and where they work best. Offices open for those who prefer in-person.
Required employees in 'connected' roles to work from the office at least 2-3 days per week. Some site-based roles require more.
CEO Alex Chriss required employees to come into the office at least 3 days per week as part of a cultural transformation push.
CEO Jack Dorsey maintained remote-first policy. Employees can work from anywhere with optional access to offices.
CEO Tobi Lutke declared 'office centricity is over.' Digital-by-default with optional in-person collaboration time.
'Remote-first' company with offices available for optional use. Employees choose their work location.
Hybrid-flexible model with offices available in major tech hubs. No strict day requirements but collaboration encouraged in-person.
Hybrid model varies by practice and client needs. Generally 2-3 days in office or at client site, with significant flexibility.
Required employees to work from the office or client site at least 3 days per week, tightening from previous 2-day policy. Began tracking locations.
Required employees in office or at client sites at least 2-3 days per week, with enforcement stepped up through attendance monitoring.
Required at least 3 days per week in office or at client sites, with partners and senior staff expected to model the behavior.
Required at least 3 days per week in office or at client sites. CEO Julie Sweet emphasized in-person work for training and mentoring.
Flexible model centered on client needs. Most consultants spend significant time at client sites with office days determined by project demands.
Hybrid model with flexibility based on client and project needs. Office attendance varies by practice and geography.
Flexible hybrid model driven primarily by client engagement needs. No company-wide day mandate.
Hybrid model requiring office-based employees to be in at least 3 days per week. Lab and manufacturing roles are fully on-site.
Required hybrid employees to work from the office at least 3 days per week. R&D and manufacturing roles are fully on-site.
Hybrid model with most corporate employees expected in office 3 days per week. Clinical and operational roles fully on-site.
Corporate employees required in office at least 3 days per week under a structured hybrid model.
Increased in-office requirement to 4 days per week at Beaverton, OR headquarters under new CEO Elliott Hill's back-to-basics strategy.
Required corporate employees at Minneapolis HQ to return 4 days per week, up from the previous hybrid arrangement.
Hybrid model with most corporate employees expected in office at least 3 days per week (Tue/Wed/Thu).
CEO David Zaslav required corporate employees to work from the office 4 days per week to foster collaboration.
Parent of NBCUniversal required corporate employees 4 days per week. Applied across both media and telecom divisions.
Required employees to work from the office at least 3 days per week under a hybrid arrangement.
Required salaried employees to work in office at least 3 days per week. CEO Mary Barra emphasizes flexibility balanced with collaboration.
CEO Elon Musk required all employees to spend at least 40 hours per week in the office, calling remote work 'morally wrong.'
US corporate employees required in office at least 3 days per week. Manufacturing and engineering roles are fully on-site.
Hybrid model requiring corporate employees in office at least 3 days per week. Network and retail roles are fully on-site.
Hybrid employees expected in office 3 days per week. CEO Mike Sievert has maintained a balanced approach to return-to-office.
Most corporate employees required in office at least 3 days per week. Engineering and manufacturing roles are fully on-site.
Hybrid model for eligible corporate roles with at least 3 days in office. Defense and classified work roles are fully on-site.
Hybrid employees expected in office at least 3 days per week. Many defense roles require full-time on-site presence.
Hybrid model requiring corporate employees to be in office at least 3 days per week. Lab and manufacturing roles are on-site.
Hybrid policy varies by division (GE Aerospace, GE Vernova, GE Healthcare). Generally 3 days in office for corporate roles.
Required corporate employees to work from the office at least 3 days per week under a structured hybrid model.
Dynamic Working model with most employees expected in office 3 days per week. Increased enforcement of attendance in 2024.
Flexible hybrid model. Employees can work from home or office based on role and preference. Offices available in major hubs.
Hybrid model requiring office-based employees to be in at least 3 days per week. Lab and manufacturing are fully on-site.
Hybrid model with most corporate employees expected in office 3 days per week. R&D and manufacturing roles are fully on-site.
Corporate employees at Issaquah, WA headquarters largely work full-time in office. Costco has maintained an in-person-first culture.
Hybrid model for corporate employees with at least 3 days expected in office. Entertainment and game studio roles vary by division.
